required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between The Quadriceps Muscle Stiffness And Patellar Alignment For Healthy People
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between The Quadriceps Muscle Stiffness And Patellar Alignment For Healthy People

brief_summary.textblock:
Patellofemoral pain is a common disease, and it often couples with patellar malalignment. Previously, imbalance of the different quadriceps muscle heads was believed to be a causative factor of patellar malignment. However, findings from electromyography studies on quadriceps activities and patellar alignment in the last two decades were inconsistent. In order to better understand the relationship between quadriceps muscle imbalance and patellar malalignment, shear wave elastography (SWE), which can measure the passive and active muscle stiffness, may shed some new lights to this area. This study aims to examine whether the quadriceps muscle stiffness can predict the patellar position. The healthy young adult will be recruited in this study. Active and passive quadriceps muscle stiffness will be measured with the SWE in different conditions and the result will be correlated with the patellar position measured with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). Also, electromyography (EMG) activity will be measured during the active stiffness measurement so as to establish the level of agreement between the EMG and SWE data. Linear regression will be used to calculate the relationship between different factors. The total number of subjects needed will be 55 by setting an effect size of 0.15 with two predictors, 80% power, and Î± at 0.05 in the linear regression.
This project will be conducted at PolyU campus and an MRI clinic in Hong Kong. Hopefully, it could be started in July 2021 and will last for 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: Patellofemoral Joint Alignment measured by MRI scanning
primary_outcome.description: Patellar displacement, patellar Alta/Baja and patellar tilt angle

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle stiffness measured by ultragraph using shear wave elastography
primary_outcome.description: Raw data of vastus lateralis, rectus femoris and vastus medialis obliquus shear modulus

secondary_outcome.description: EMG data of vastus lateralis, rectus femoris and vastus medialis obliquus
Maximum isometric knee extensor muscle strength at specific joint angle (30 degrees and 60 degrees knee flexion)

study_pop.textblock: Healthy subject without patellofemoral joint problem
